review: This place is honestly so great. The customer service, the manager talks to everyone and is so cool and sweet. Their entire staff is AWESOME. The food, is delicious. The buffalo sauce cauliflower and avocado rolls are our favorite. The cucumber revival and fresh brewed iced tea are delicious. We come here all the time because it's simply great. They do a great job here and should be applauded for it!!  Also,  Our server Greg was great :)

Not a huge fan of chain restaurant food, you can really tell that it is mass produced. Service was fine, food ready quickly, but I feel the prices really don't justify the quality of the food. My salad was huge, but really anything other than healthy. The pizzas are on the small side and the noodle dishes lacking flavor. While this is a more affordable dining option that some others here, I would splurge and eat something better while in Santa Barbara, not worth returning.

I love the food here. I usually come to this location twice a month (and because I live blocks away from here). Everytime I used to come here, it was ok. Again food is great, but service is awful. Although, I never feel the need to complaint. Sometime 2 weeks ago, we came again, we got sat right away. But bummmm, I saw a server passing by many times and she just ignored us, I called her many times, but she just ignored us.. Such a pain everytime she was taking care of the rest of the customers and keep ignoring us. Finally someone else pass by and I called her, we waited around 30 mins to been noticed. She said sorry, I will call your server. But when she tried to call her it seems that she didnt want to take our order. Anyways at the end someone else took our order and the other girl who supposed to be our server never even say sorry or anything. She was giving us a really bad attitude, like if she didnt even wanted us there. HER NAME IS LIZ, it was the only thing I needed to know after I left the restaurant. It was very frustrating been there, and the only reason why I stay was because my daughters were starving. I would never go there anymore... Now I dislike this location. (I even called corporate) Update So I got a private message by someone who runs the yelp page (from CPK office) and trying to apologize, they ask me to filled out some info online and they were gonna get back to me. But they never did. That's how you lose customers, and end up going out of business.
CPK is our " Go To " place. We eat in and order out and always fresh and great! One of the Managers " Michelle" is always so sweet to us !!

I very much thought of this place to be very good and I loved how we were seated at our table by a friendly younger boy who actually did his job very well! I loved the attitude! We were even recommended these specialty drinks they had only at the pizza kitchen I was iffy about but was NOT disappointed. The food came out great and even the simple chips & salsa didn't seem stale because have come across a majority of places that have the worst when it comes to that. The vibe was pretty friendly and our server was nice. No second guessing while we were there at all. It wasn't so busy either because it was on a Saturday. I would to like try the rest of the plates and entrees they had to offer so next time! The area seems a bit clean but not a lot of resources stocked fully when I was using the restroom. If I'm ever in the area again craving the same thing from last time I'll be back again.

I typically don't like writing reviews that are below 4 stars, but tonight, I wasn't all too impressed with CPK.  We were seated right away, which wasn't all too surprising, considering my significant other and I came at around 8pm on a Wednesday night. We started off with the avocado egg rolls, which comprise of chicken, bacon, cheese, and avocado. Now normally these egg rolls are amazing, but it wasn't hot when we got them. It tasted it they were out for a while. Next came the waldorf chicken salad and the california club pizza. The waldorf salad was simple, but flavorful. I think there was slightly too much dressing, but that's okay. I really love the gorgonzola in the salad- paired nicely with the apples and candied walnuts! The california club pizza on the other hand... while the avocados and tomatoes were fresh, the pizza itself wasn't hot. Again, it seemed like the pizza was sitting out. The pizza itself was stale, which is really disappointing, considering I was craving this pizza tonight.  The server was okay, but she didn't ask us if we wanted dessert, which made me think that maybe she just wanted to close out and go home? I don't know- I really wanted the butter cake, but I lost my appetite once I felt like we were being somewhat rushed. Not sure how I feel about CPK after this experience. It's not a 1 star, but I was definitely disappointed.
Special menu for us veterans on Veterans Day. I chose the BBQ Chicken salad. It came with warm bread and an olive oil herb dip. Thanks for your cheerful and generous service!

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary dinner and I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty the food was! My boyfriend got the Louisiana style jambalaya and I got a barbecue chicken pizza. Both plates were pretty good (even though this restaurant is a little pricey). Overall, I really enjoyed my dinner here and I had a great time!

My boyfriend and I came here on a semi crowded night and were seated after 15 minutes or so.  We got seated in a very dark table and I asked if they could turn on our light but I guess they hadn't replaced it yet. It was so dark to the point I need to use my phone to read the menu.  Anyways, our waitress gave us our bread and asked us multiply times if we wanted more bread so it seemed she was overwhelmed. We ordered our drinks and it took longer than usual for her to give us the drink but I guess they were having problems with their ticket machine.   I signed up for the rewards and received a free small plate. We chose the white corn and guacamole and chips for our free plate. It was good but the guacamole and corn is very small and it needed salt.   I ordered a Hawaiian pizza and my boyfriend ordered the original bbq chicken which were all very tasty :)  Although they were many problems, I would still come back.

Place is a lot bigger inside than I realized.  My brother and I stopped in here ... to be honest, I have two distinct memories of CPK.  1) The Twilight premier when I was taken here by the girl I was going with, and 2) a really awkward lunch with two people who weren't really my friends. Thankfully this experience was a lot better than the last two, because I had always thought CPK was a good "fast food" option, and it was affirmed going here last night. My bro and I were seated at a 2 person booth.  We were offered fresh bread.  Our waitress was really nice (don't remember her name) and attentive.  I really loved my strawberry lemonade I got, and my bro tried it and liked it too! My bro ordered a four cheese and tomato pizza and seemed to enjoy it.  I got one of their seasonal specials, a curly pasta in a mushroom sauce.  Yummmm, it was so good!  My bro kept on stealing it from me so I had to give him some. I was really pleased with the amount of vegetarian options that CPK offers.  It makes me really happy to see restaraunts who are willing to serve all kinds of customers -- especially having one of their monthly specials be vegetarian (and marking what's vegetarian with a symbol on the menu)  I know that, in the future, I will come back to CPK if it's an option in the mall.

the prices have gone way up I went in a month ago and it was a three ring child circus. For dining somewhere where you are going to spend 50 dollars on a chain for one person it should not be chucky cheese. The staff didn't seem to care and seated families close to me when there were other spots available. Then they send pizza kitchen emails. No, No thank you for this price I can eat at the wine cask a real honest to God Santa Barbara nice dining place and not have to deal with kids r us

Our server last night was horrible! I didn't get her name but she was a (white?) female with short dark red hair... She never came to check on us, I had to keep calling her over when I wanted something. She never refilled my drink even though the empty glass was at the edge of the table. Even if she was serving the table next to us, she never stopped at our table to see if we needed anything.  Because she never checked on us, we were there for a long time as there would be long periods of time where I wouldn't see her. At one point I even asked another server, Virginia, to refill my drink. Virginia was so friendly and when she brought my drink she asked if there was anything else we needed! That's all we expect from a good server- attentiveness. Thank you Virginia!

After a good while of trying to avoid chains I ended up at CPK, and you know what, they could be an exception to the idea that chains are bland.  It was good, real good. SO is very concerned with hygiene practices and rightly or wrongly sees corporately owned businesses as having to be held to the standards of a high visibility, as a result it can make choosing a place to eat out difficult.  So...we ended up at CPK in Santa Barbara.  Really though, I liked it, she felt comfortable and in the end that's what matters most. Jerk Chicken thin crust...good.  Sweet in the right way, tangy in the right way.  All around a good little pie.  Beer selection it's alright...could definitely use a couple more taps, and probably less Sam Adams. Service good, better than most mid level chains, ambiance definitely better than most.  Clean decor, nice airy main dining room.   Hopefully the hygiene practices fear is a passing one, but I would go back to CPK either way.

Has very good safety protocols for preparing gluten free pizzas. Being a celiac, this is extremely comforting when eating out. The pizza was fairly good. My only critique was that it was a bit pricey for the size it was.

After waiting for 20 mins the couple next to us left the restaurant. We stayed there some more mins and left as well. This is ridiculous!!!  No service at all. It's not recommendable.  I would give no stars if possible.

We love it here! The manager, Michelle, is always SO SWEET when we come, taking the time to make sure our experience is a positive one. For Mother's Day, she was giving out little gift bags. How sweet is that?!! The food here never disappoints, and our server Krystal checked on us often, making sure all dishes were great. Thank you for making today special!!!
Good Pizza place and I love their Pizza It's so good there. They have excellent service and great staff. I went here like 4 times with a group and 2 times with a friend Definitely coming here again.

Just like any other CPK in any other city. If you're just visiting SB I wouldn't come here because there's just so many other places you can try that are local and mom and pop places! You can try CPK anywhere else.. but I have been here a few times. Pizza is great as it should be.

Saturday night n it was busy. Still, we got a seat within 15 min. My usual order at any CPK is one of their specialty salads n jambalaya. So I got the half order of grilled veggie salad and the jambalaya (only one size available for jambalaya).... N I gotta have the olive oil on the table, I drown everything in it)... Jambalaya was delicious as always, spicy with black pepper and chunky with fat shrimps, crawfish, chicken, sausages... My BF ordered the chicken tequila fettuccine which was WOW, my new fave! Such great flavors. Our server was very good with checking on us. He was constantly apologizing cuz food was very slow to come outta the kitchen. Maybe cuz everyone was ordering pasta. The manager was also making her rounds apologizing n comping desserts and bringing out more bread. Our usual 1.5 hour dining became a 2.5 hour waitfest. Took the butter cake to go and that was pretty good.  Still, love our waiter. Loved the food. Loved my company.... All was still brilliant.
Service was good, every dish and glass was disgustingly dirty!!!  Where are the health inspectors?
Bad service. Can't handle all the people there at the paseo... just go to any other place.

I arrived at the location in Santa  Barbara ordered a thin crust barbecue chicken pizza to go and 1/2 salad, after waiting for about 40 minutes, our order was ready, the box didn't feel warm, I thought oh its a "to go " box that's sealed....NO NO NO, the pizza was COLD!!! I get back to my Room ACROSS TOWN in fact the pizza looked aged and it was cold, called and spoke with Manager named Eric, he apologized and offered to make a piping hot pizza....its late I'm across town, Eric said their pizza warmer was working and not sure why the pizza's cold.  Eric asked how I paid, I replied a card, so Eric agreed to to credit back my CC for the pizza. About 15 after hanging up, it dawned on me that I PAID CASH, I had Sun Chip, granola and salad for dinner! Terrible experience.....Check your pizza before leaving establishment.

I really enjoy CPK. I understand it's not anything extraordinary, but if you're ever craving American food (mainly pasta and pizza), I'd give this place a try. The service was also very nice.  My ultimate favorite: garlic cream fettuccine with shrimp. It's so flavorful and yummy!
This place was pretty good. Had their classic Caesar salad which was pretty well put together. For my main dish I got the chicken tequila fettuccine which was delicious!!!

This is my first negative review on Yelp. Sanitation conditions were terrible in this restaurant! There were several pieces of pasta stuck in a "clean" fork that was given to us for our meal. There was also a dead bug in my wife's salad. Terrible and unsatisfactory.

First time at CPK in Paseo Nuevo.. They gave us quite a lot of time to think about what drinks and food we wanted to order! Food wait was quite long. Our waitress checked up on us twice... After that she disappeared and we had to ask a different waitress for more of our needs such as when we asked for more dressing for my uncle's salad the waitress we asked came passing by us with us thinking she have forgotten (because we don't see our waitress around) what we asked for because they made us wait awhile so our waitress comes to surface (Idk where she's been) came back with a dressing cup of one or two little drops of dressing and mostly added water into the dressing cup! My uncle said his salad dressing tasted like water. That was really unfortunate!!  Besides that, the food was decent as I had the Garlic cream Fettuccine with chicken and shrimp. Although I felt if I didn't add shrimp into my pasta I wouldn't be satisfied because the chicken was cut in little bits. There's was barely any chicken.. (you can see in the photo below, you'd be like I don't see any chicken.. you see what I mean!!) Anyway I've had better pasta elsewhere. I just know this time I won't be getting pasta here. Maybe I'll try their pizza one day.. or not.

Truly so disappointed in my experience dinning here. Not only was the service so slow but the silverware was dirty, the food ( which was a simple pizza) came out 25 minutes later, and we asked for water refills 4 times before someone came to the table. Not worth it at all.....

Host took forever to seat us - not because it was too busy and there were a lot of people but because she was busy gossiping with co-workers. Other staff passed us by because maybe it wasn't their job.  Be warned you'll eat with plastic spoons and forks because their dishwasher is broken. It's also a bit warm perhaps the AC isn't working well.  Overall it's just not worth it. Look for Rev pizza around the corner. It's just so much better.

California Pizza Kitchen is most definitely my favorite chain. This specific location is most definitely my favorite location. The manger is always very friendly and working hard when you see her. Gabby is a great hostess with the mostess. I don't remember any of the severs names but there's this one guy who's really funny. If the employees are reading this you guys can argue over who think it might be. Anyway, I love the food here. Although my only complaint, and this goes for every single CPK in the world, there is NO avoiding the god awful, horrendous sound of the silverware scraping against the plates. I'm so careful with every single bite, but still, the nails against chalkboard sound amplifies through my brain. I predict I will be deaf by age 29. But still, great food.

My first visit was pleasant. Although the place busy.....we were served accordingly. Our second visit was horrible. Service was not up to par. First we were not given any bread for the wait, second our drink was not re filled and third I have to wait for my utensil. I will not be eating there again.
Never come on the weekend. Slow. Staff simply doesn't care. Pedestrian food that is good with kids. This location needs management help.
The wait was well over an hour and order was not completely correct. Good food and clean with somewhat decent service and refills.

I used to like this place. The food is good but the service and wait time to order sucks. Waiters are too busy making jokes with each other they forget their working. I asked for water twice and it's been 45 mins. It's really sad. This place was one of my favorite places to eat. I've given CPK three visits before I posted a bad review and it's amazing I received the same poor service every time. Never again...
Come on! California pizza kitchen, they're everywhere. Service at this particular spot was cool. Young lady was new, but service was excellent!

I've been a CPK fan for years but this was my first visit to the SB location.  The server was friendly and efficient but the food quality has gone down.   The Asian chic salad had a fake sugary dressing and the lettuce was so soggy and bruised.  The appetizers of dumplings were all dense bread with empty insides.   I asked the server 3 times to clear the table in between courses and she pretended not to hear me. Sadly I don't think I will be returning to this CPK location , there are too many other great pizza options in SB with local healthy fresh ingredients.

My friend ordered a soup to go, and we literally waited an hour for it. She also asked for a cup of water which they forgot until she got up to ask again. A girl came up to us and asked what we were waiting for and pretended to care for a split second, and then walked in the other direction and completely forgot. I used to love CPK but I'm so annoyed that I literally never want to eat here again.
Had a great experience here being a vegan thanks to the sweetest waitress Krystal ! She brought out the whole menu with the ingredients in each plate!

Me and the roomies went to CPK for dinner this past Saturday. We had a bit of a spinach and artichoke themed dinner which we didn't even realize until the waitress was like "wow! u girls sure are spinach lovers" LOL! I was a bit annoyed at first because we went to CPK and put our name down and they told us there would be a 25 minute wait, so we went to Sephora to spend the time and came back 5 minutes or so before it was supposed to be our turn but then we went back up to them they said they had called our name 20 minutes ago??? That was pretty strange and so we ended up having to wait longer and the host person just came off a bit rude.. Anyway though, once we were seated our waitress was really sweet and nice and helpful so I would still say the service was generally good. For appetizers we ordered spinach and artichoke dip and the crispy mac and cheese. Both were good, but we weren't too impressed by the mac and cheese things and probably wouldn't order it again. The dip was really yummy though! Then for the entree we got a thin crust spinach and artichoke pizza and I really liked that too! My roommates mostly ordered the food because I didn't have much preference but I didn't expect to like the spinach and artichoke stuff as much as I did. I like spinach, but have never been a fan of too much cheese or artichoke in food, but it was all actually really delicious! This was definitely enough food for the three of us, we were completely stuffed afterwards. Also the price was reasonable considering! I've always loved CPK and this was another good trip :^)

Bottom Line:  This place is surprisingly good and consistently so       My wife is obsessed with this place's spinach dip and thin-ass pizzas, so I find myself sitting at a CPK table more often than I ever thought I would.  i have to admit though, their pizzas are consistently very good as well as the service.      The place is always clean and they seem to be slammed a lot as well.

For a chain style restaurant, this is one of my favorites.  The bbq chicken pizza is always my go to whenever I visit a CPK.  However, all of them look good. Don't get a plain pepperoni though. You're at a CPK.  They're known for their unusual pizzas. Venture out and try something different! They also have very good appetizers and a nice selection of beers, wine, and cocktails. The only negative about this specific CPK is that they don't have a/c. Normally, not a problem, but I'd stay away on hot days.
Wouldn't let me exchange my gift cards for different amounts. I don't see what the issue is here. The Mgr didn't even come out to explain it to me. Not happy at all! Don't get CPK gift cards!

Good food, but rude servers. On my lunch break and wanted to treat myself to a good sandwich and soup. Waited almost 30minutes to get it. When I asked my server if my food was almost ready he just said "yeah" and walked away before I could finish asking him my question. I almost walked out at that point, but I was so hungry I stayed. 2 minutes later my food came. Wasn't anything too special.

Ok so if you have incredibly high standards, I doubt your going to eat at a chain restaurant... But I enjoy coming to this CPK. Matt who usually works the bar is amazing and his section is where we sit if he is there. I am always surprised by people who eat out and feel it's a license to treat wait staff poorly, which is what I tend to see happen at chain restaurants pretty often. So I try to be extra nice and forgiving when things are not perfect.  It rarely happens here , but if it does , I treat the people respectfully and guess what? They happily fix it.... Today we had the rib-eye, a newer dish, and it was amazing. I am so glad they offer a meat dish, because sometimes you just want a good piece of melt in your mouth meat. The cook did an exceptional job on this dish... We also tried the new pizza that had potatoes and egg on it ( I know WTF, right??) but it was very good. We would have it again. It's great to see CPK thinking differently about their food selections because they were starting to get bland and boring... Michelle, the manager, is always one of our favorite people there in addition to Matt... We will keep driving the 40 min to eat there just for them...

Love the location, this was a good place for drinks & apps with my best friend. Our server Jose was great! We loved the food from the small plates menu and the sangria was delicious! Will be back again :)

An employee handed me a bag with my pizza and salad in it, to go. The pizza box was put in vertical causing it to end up as a calzone! The oil for the bread was also broken open in the bag, leaking oil everywhere.  Ruined experience, won't be back.

This is one of my daughter's and my favorite restaurant to dine in at.  She loves their Sedona Tortilla Soup and I love their Thai Crunch Salad.  She eats a little of my dish and I have a little of her soup, and we're both happy campers! We ate here this past weekend and can't say that we have any complaints.  The hostess was very friendly offering us a booth window.  We were happy to be able to people watch.  Lots of that in Santa Barbara!  Our waitress was very jolly immediately greeting us and offering us drinks and our menus.  Shortly after we placed our orders and received our bread.  Then right after that we received our soup and salad. The one thing that I love about California Pizza Kitchens is that everyone knows their menu who has ate at one of their restaurants and can expect that same quality of food wherever you go.  My daughter's soup was very tasty and my salad was delicious. We came around 11:30 on a Sunday, and they surprisingly weren't too busy.  We seemed to have beat the crowds because a half an hour later they really started to fill up.  At first I was surprised at how empty the restaurant was because I am always used to seeing the Hawaii ones packed to the gills along with a wait time.  I liked how relaxing the atmosphere felt in comparison to how busy California Pizza Kitchens normally are. The next time we're in Santa Barbara, you can count on us being back!

As I sit amidst the throng of people I cannot help but feel I have entered the Third Ring of Hell.  The air is not moving, save the heavy, labored breathing of the patrons.  It has to be 95° inside here.  Luckily the music is so loud that it is drowning out the conversations of the people around, and at my table, or I am certain I would be hearing from others about how hot and ridiculously loud it is in here. On a side note the appetizer eas good.  Some sort of eggroll avocado creation.  I will update after the entrée arrives.

I've been to CPK many times and this review is only for the location in Santa Barbara, I believe the waitress's name was Danielle or Daniella, ordered 1 pizza (half/half) and my girlfriend got a drink. Food came out, instead of 1 pizza it was 2 pizza's, one half and half with random things we didn't order, one full pizza of what she had ordered. I've been to this location several times and we both always order the same thing (split a pizza), this time the waitress told me I was wrong and that I ordered incorrectly instead of fixing the issue. We talked to the manager who then took 1 pizza off of our bill which solved nothing since we still had a pizza we never even ordered that was now off of our bill.

Prices keep going up, quality and service, has gone way down. Floor manager has been there way to long, and has a chip on her shoulder, never smiles, and looks like she's miserable ALL the time. Maybe it's time for an upgrade. Only thing that kept me coming back is the super nice and attentive folks at the pick up counter. But now they recently changed their chicken on some items and the BBQ chicken chopped from a rotisserie type to a charred disaster that is hard, dry, and tastes like it was literally on fire... I asked for fresh chicken, and was brought the same exact chicken that looked at tasted like it was made last week...the waitress was new and embarrassed, so had the manager come by, she insisted at my table side that it was fresh, but you could tell it was straight out of a fridge, it was ice cold, and she was so confrontational that I just let it go. At $14.00 for a salad, the chicken better be orgasmic. On the same salad they also changed the cubed jicama to this shredded limp noodle resembling, no flavor, gross, wasted money of an ingredient I've ever tasted. Been my fav salad for 10 years, and the floor manager made me feel like I was being ridiculous when I talked to her about the chicken, and jicama, that looked more like cheese than a veggie, not only that, but I asked what was in a drink before I ordered it, they failed to mention it had ginger, when I asked, the bar manager said no, it didn't have ginger after I tasted it and knew it did. Floor manager confirmed it did as I already knew, when I got the bill, both items were on the bill regardless of the fact that neither was consumed, and not even an apology. Spinach dip used to be so good, now they put it in a microwave, and it's so hard around the edges and sticky it's hard to eat, and doesn't taste good anymore. Stay away, until they get their act together, and they aren't pricing their food like they're a higher end restaurant than the Fish House or more trendy than Eureka.
Well managed location, staff are professional and the food is a little better than other locations.  The Santa Barbara location adds to the ambiance, upscale CPK!

I've had better luck at other CPK locations but the food in SB is iffy at best. The two stars is simply because the service here has always been good for me. Last time (and it probably will be) we ordered the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza & Veggie salad. The pizza came out and we both took one bite and choked on the amount of salt burning down our esophagus. We were kindly able to reorder another pizza, this  time Pear and Gorgonzola which was overcooked but on the plus side had better lettuce on it than our Veggie salad which was totally pathetic with tooth breaking hard kernels of corn?
I think once you've been one CPK you've been to them all. Can't go wrong, great food, great service and good drinks!

been a fan of cpk for a long time! & this cpk didnt disappoint ! came on thursday night and got seated within 5 minutes ! the waitress was very friendly and was very attentive, always asking if we needed anything and how our food was. the food is great ! i got the carne asada pizza and the chicken tequila fettuccine. it was  very filling and delicious. plus it was my friends bday. the waitress brought out a free dessert with a candle. great experience overall
Love this place. I went with my friend on a birthday party. Please was little crowed but okay for us. Will be back.

Made reservation for 7 people at 7:35. My party was told 30-40 minutes. At 8:20 we asked how our table was coming along and were told another 10 minutes. By then we were starting to get annoyed. So again at 8:30 we asked where our table was and we were told another 15 to 20 minutes. Our hostess did not apologize but only told us that is a Friday night and we are busy. Finally at 8:50 we were seated, a whole 75 minutes later, and while we were being showed to our table out hostess made a rude remarks to us. Once we were seated our waitress was very pleasant the rest of our meal went well.

I thought I had reviewed this before. It's not like a fancy 4 star but it is a solid place and NEVER better than it is now.  They now have a razor thin pizza crust and a lot of new options on the menu, including a healthy choice section with a fantastic salmon and succotash. Cedar plank , just great.  The BBQ chicken salad--minus crunches plus avocado--is still solid and the half is big enough, 9.99 That horrendous Wonder bread they used to pass off as actual bread is gone and they have spectacular sourdough now.  The service is always good and the manager , Michelle, terrific. My sister worked at Marina Del Rey CPK (replaced Mr D's, the diner of my childhood on weekends when we lived at my parents' boat) around the same time!  The wine list is fine and they have a great price on Kendall Jackson Chardonnay.  The kids' menu is also good , so it's family friendly The "low light' green nonsense is still in place but you get used to eating in the dark lol.  And the green napkins seem to have been replaced by the normal white ones, which is good.  This is a solid place time in and time out.
I love their spinach artichoke dip! Their Chinese chicken salad is really good too! But my favorite is their chicken tequila fettuccine! Soooo good

The foods never exactly bad...buuut I used to love CPK and I'm always disappointed now. The food quality just continues to go down. And at this location this is the second time the waiter has left their shift and no one picked it up after them. So...we sit there. Confused. Do you not want a tip? Or to get paid? I'd leave a lower amount of stars but the food is still...ok. And everyone's still been mostly nice.

poor service, they forgot to give us our pizza since we had ordered to go and by the time i reminded them we had already ordered, the pizza was cold. also be warned the thin crust is especially thin compared to most other places.

Great place to get your pizza or pasta fix! :) can't go wrong with the garlic cream Fettucine or the BBQ chicken pizza!  They have a nice policy where you can try something new & if you don't like it, get something else no questions asked! I didn't really like the Thai chicken pizza and they quickly got me the bbq chicken instead :)

We were so happy with the service at CPK.  We were celebrating my 21st birthday. We walked in just to ask a few questions and the manager was there to greet us with a friendly and kind response.  She made us want to stay.  We had previously been to another restaurant for dinner but were underwhelmed with the service.  Coming here was a breath of fresh air.  The bartender that served us was kind and friendly and answered all of our crazy questions.  They made me feel like it was the most important day of the year with their service.  They continued to check on us throughout our visit.  They even brought us a delicious free dessert!  The other place did not even wish me a happy birthday.  I highly recommend this CPK for the service, care and drinks! Thanks Jose for being a great bartender!!!
Because the pasta portion was tiny. Otherwise this place would have received 4-5 stars.  Also, it's been redone. Looks good! Manager was nice.

It's UCSB move in weekend 9/18 and the restaurant was not staffed sufficiently to welcome and serve customers.  Came in at 1:11 and they said they had a limited service staff and for a party of six we would have to wait thirty minutes.  Unacceptable so we went across the street to Eureka where we were seated immediately.  Poor planning on the part of management.

Had an early dinner at CPK in Santa Barbara. Enjoyed the Moroccan Spiced Chicken Salad. The half size was perfect especially when splitting a dessert afterward. Their Belgian Chocolate Soufflé Cake with Ice Cream was quite yummy too!

Went to CPK for the first time since they remolded and got their new menu- and I have to say I was very impressed. I absolutely love how they remodeled it- feels much more local even though it is a corporate chain. All of the new options on the menu look  amazing as well. Our host was very friendly and knowledgable. Our drinks were constantly being refilled, our server was on top of it. I ordered the steak- and I have to say it was one of the best slabs of meat I have ever had. Literally. I think that is what I will get  this every time from now on  because it was so good. Overall  a very good experience. The only downside was they had to get rid of some of the indoor seating for people to wait. They were very busy and there was not a lot of standing room inside.  But I will defiantly be back soon!

Ok for starters agro Mexican guy with red eyes serving me seriously?  Buds at CPK? Had to ask for bread and he didn't even offer. Hair in my pasta! Told the waiter, he asks me you want me to get you another one? Uh no thanks I suddenly lost my appetite. Terrible service! After I received my salad my waiter disappeared. Oh the manager brought me my salad in a jiffy and said he was sorry. When I received my bill, nothing was discounted at all. Time was 8:00pm Tuesday 7/16/14  Ok return to this restaurant a few weeks later The Stoner guy wasn't working there anymore and the service was a 360° turn around. It was a bit hot and stuffy in there and requested that The air-conditioning be turned on. Problem solved immediately. This time my visit was a bit splendid with better service and happier looking employees. Also I noticed the manager was really paying attention to what's going on in there. I'm upgrading my rating to 3 stars. The managements paying attention to customers needs.

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses. Food was descent , but service was slow . I think they were busy . We went on Saturday night  So maybe that is why . Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

Good service, the management politely addressed my concern that my order of corn guacamole and chips didn't have enough guacamole, but I did have to speak up about it. Who wants to eat half their chips dry? My kid's plate of fusilli Alfredo was unimpressive, I'm glad it didn't cost much. Prices are just a little too high for what you get IMHO.
GREAT costumer service, the waitress and manager were so sweet and made sure we were enjoying our meals. Great food too!

This is the 3rd time in a week that i come here and i love it!  I am a regular at this place and i usually get the spicy chicken piccata ... The restaurant is clean, most of the employees are nice, good location on sate street near all the stores.. with a private parking lot.

CPK is a family favorite but our last visit was made extra special by the manager who took the time to ask if and why we enjoyed our meal. Also entertained my 9 year-old daughter with conversation...and treated her to a dessert. Thank you Eric for going the extra mile and giving us outstanding service especially during a hectic dinner shift!

Chloe was our server and she's amazing!!  She suggested the sangria and she was right on. Very sweet and attentive to my kiddo, and the rest of the party!! The food was exactly what I expected but the service made it worth it!  Thank u Chloe for a great lunch experience!
I liked the manager's attentiveness. He was very concerned that we were happy and that we liked his food. And it was good!
We eat here often.  The service is great and the food is healthy and delicious.  They are always happy to modify any dish to your liking.  We will be back
Good was great. We had the garlic fettuccini Alfredo with chicken shrimp and mushroom. Highly recommend it!

I was so sad when our local CPK shut down, so needless to say, I was pretty stoked when I saw that SB had one!  It was about  a 15-minute wait during a Friday night dinner rush. Service was decent & I was happy to find out that bread is offered with meals. It's a small baguette, but this is a new addition that I liked. (Plus, the dipping oil with all the spices was yummy.) My hubby & I shared a pepperoni pizza with garlic & the tomato basil spaghettini with chicken breast (which was perfect for two people). The pizza was absolutely delicious! The pepperoni had just the right amount of spice, the crust was crispy but not burnt, perfection! (On a side note, why did they change their dough recipe? I remember it used to have a touch of sweetness, which I miss. But I digress.) The spaghettini definitely benefited from the chicken & their sauce was every bit as delish as I remembered it.  Even though their prices are on the higher side, it's always one of our go-to places for some grubby food.

I was dragged in here kicking and screaming, but I needed to refuel from a hard day of wine tastin and shopping on State Street, and I am glad I gave in. THIS is what the ideal California Pizza Kitchen experience should be like.  - Quick, competent staff. - Full glasses, with drinks that do not taste watered down and actually compliment the meal. - Food that lives up to its name: The white corn/guacamole was very refreshing, the shrimp lettuce wraps were in healthy portions AND vibrant with flavor, the BBQ Chicken pizza.....   ...let me tell you about this. The chicken was moist and tasted quite fresh, not like stuff that was kept in a freezer for a while. The dough was just cripsy and soft in the right places that I like in my pizza, and there was no need to request extra cheese or bbq sauce, as everything worked very well in terms of bringing out a fresh bbq combination. Even the red onions worked added that "crisp bite" of complexity to the pizza.  Make no mistake, this is not a gourmet pizza, but rather a simple but great pizza that works well. Everything on my Sunday afternoon was better because the meal my friends and I enjoyed here.

Amazing experience from the moment they opened the door for us . From the greeter to the manager- friendly, helpful, attentive. Funny thing- the power went out while we were there and the manager came around with a free meal ticket for each table for the inconvenience! Food was great too:)

Food was tasty. We had the chinese chicken salad and the bbq chicken pizza on the honey wheat crust. Service was rather slow. And our waitress didn't understand that salad should come before our food.

Cannot remember that last time( if ever) I have had such a negative and rude interaction with a restaurant hostess. I walk in meeting a friend for lunch. As we are walking into the very empty restaurant, both us hear, "please sit where ever you like". Like I said the restaurant is almost empty. We select a booth by a window that was just vacated. The buser walks over to us and says he will clean the table. He does and my friend and I sit down. A few moments later the same hostess who told us to sit where ever we like, rudely insists that we get up and move so she can seat another party of four. She says over and over that we shouldn't have sat down on our own and that she had a family that needs a table. Not only is she rude however she stars at us, repeatedly interrupts us, telling us to get up and go back to the front and wait for her to find us a table(in the almost empty restaurant)The people she is seating see how awkward this situation is and ask to be seated somewhere else. The hostess was on a mission to get my friend and I to move. Well move we did, right across to Eureka Burger. It's not a privilege to eat at CPK! Whether we misunderstood the hostess in the beginning is irrelevant. You forced two patrons to leave your nearly empty restaurant because of a misunderstanding. Horrible horrible experience! Like I said I cannot remember ever having such a negative and rude experience in a restaurant.

CPK has gone through a transformation and it is no longer the friendly restaurant with yummy food it used to be. It's now a full-on chain looking to get as much money out of your pockets as possible while providing you with as little food as they can get away with serving for the price. I got a half salad and what used to be a sizable salad is now basically a side salad. It was also $11!! For a side salad. All the prices HIGHER across the board. Ridiculous. In addition to this the servers now push everything on you, sparkling water, appetizers, dessert, avocado, their rewards program etc...it was awkward to have to keep saying no... A LONG time favorite we won't be going back to...
It was lunch and when the server came he was playing with something in his mouth and spited on me. The waiter (pascual) didn't even say anything and i lost my appetite. I will never come back!

I'm only going to give this restaurant two stars because I sort of like the food, especially the little appetizer plates they've started to offer. And that's where it ends. I can't give it more because of the Joe, the host they have (or hopefully, had) working as a host. And his manager, who would rather defend him and his crappy behavior than listen to a customer.  My fiance and I went on a Friday night for some dinner and told Joe we'd like to go sit at the bar. However, when we went to the bar it was full so we came back to the front so he asked us if we'd like to wait for something at the bar to open up or sit at a table. While he was asking us, another couple walked in behind us; my fiance and I barely had time to look at each other and decide, and didn't even get the chance to answer when Joe was already walking off with the couple that had just walked in to seat them at a table. WTF? Seriously, he didn't give us 2 seconds to answer before he was seating people that came in after us and when we came back we were like, "Dude, what the heck was that all about?" And his excuse was that we didn't have an answer for him so he decided to just seat the other couple instead.  All I could do was look at him because I was so shocked by his rudeness and stupidity. So we walked out. I called the manager because I was so put off by this man's rudeness, tone, and attitude, and all she did was defend him and tell me how he always gets high secret shopper scores. Seriously Idiot? I worked in retail and trust me, you always, ALWAYS know when you're getting a secret shopper. Secret shoppers aren't that secret because they try too damn hard to act normal, you can point them out from a mile away.  Then, on what will be my last visit ever, I had the pleasure of meeting Joe again when my friends decided they wanted to meet me for dinner at CPK. We were told by Mr. Personality himself that it would be about a 30 minute wait. So we grabbed some chairs outside and waited for 35-40 minutes, even after we noticed that people who had come in after us were being seated. And when my friend, who was recovering from having pins stuck into his broken ankle, hobbled up and confronted Joe about it, the guy flat out lied to him and told him they had come in before us. Lies, lies, lies!  So my friend with the swollen ankle being fused together by metal asked Joe how much longer it would be before we were seated, his response, after he rolled his eyes, was "30 seconds". Oh haha, yes, very funny.  5 minutes later we eventually had a table. And I can't really remember what I ate, or if I liked it, or what my server was like because the most dominant memory I will always have of this place is the rude guy up at the front and the management that is happy to let him get away with it.
This place amazes every time I go there. Pascual is the best bartender/waiter. I highly recommend the wild mushroom pizza.  Now they have lagunita IPA
good drinks but bad service, had to go inside and get everything ourselves. it was like lord of the flies out here, every man for himself

Just got done with dinner and it was exceptional. Our waitress Cara was the best and did everything to make our experience the best possible. Not to mention the garlic chicken pizza and Chinese chicken salad were to die for. While the food was good, our waitress made the experience 5 stars. Will be going back again soon.

This has got to be the worst CPK I've ever been to: 1) The wait time was much, much longer than what they stated.  2) The dish I ordered was the worst I've had from other CPK's. My pasta was dry and lukewarm.  3) The waiter forgot to bring out our soup.  Needless to say, I would not return to this one.

Came in on a Saturday night so it was a decently busy.  I ordered the 'new' garlic chicken pizza. It was alright, at best. The crust was subpar, and it seemed to be mostly crust. And what else is there to really say? It's garlic and chicken. You can't screw that up! :) My girlfriend ordered the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza, on a 'regular crust' - as it used to be made before they switched to their thin crust. As our food came, they had made the wrong crust, and she was pretty bummed, so we waited for another pizza... Which she ended up getting once I had already finished my pizza. Not a huge deal, but still somewhat of annoyance.  Her mother ordered something that the waiter had specifically told her was not 'spicy'. I ended up trying it... Although not 'spicy' it was definitely 'hot', like a wasabi hot. Definitely gross nonetheless, and again, had to get another plate of chicken without the sauce.  All in all, pretty decent service for being a Saturday night. Food all in all... Meh. I'm not a huge fan of CPK. I've been here multiple times, and never do I leave feeling like I got what I paid for. I'd honestly eat at dominos if I wanted a better, more filling, cheaper pizza.

It had been years since I last ate at a CPK.  I used to eat at the one in Burbank about 15 years ago when the chain hadn't expanded quite as much, yet.   The bf and I met up  with friends at this Pase Nuevo restaurant last week for dinner.  (It was a stopover while doing some holiday traveling.)   I was a bit curious as to how the food would be.   I'd remembered the pizzas as being interesting before (if a bit weird.) We ordered a pizza and a Thai Crunch salad to share.    I liked the Thai Crunch salad.   It has way too much dressing on it, but it tasted nice (I'd order it again.) The pizza, however, was a disappointment.  The texture of the bread was bland and uninspiring.  I could make better crust at home, easily. I don't know if the quality of the chain has eroded, or I've gotten used to better restaurants for my money. Sort of a bland Boboli quality to it. At any rate, we didn't finish eating the pizza.  We'd been pretty hungry.  As soon as the salad took the edge off my hunger, I was less enthusiastic about the pizza portion pf the meal.
What a great resturant at a great locatoon. A bit hidden from all the crazy :) great service fresh food. Always happy to be here.

They probably deserve 2.5 stars, but I'm an asshole so I round down. Seriously, I want you to ignore my review and go eat there. You need to experience for yourself how shitty their food is. I bet they served better food at the internment camps. The food in the dining commons was straight up gourmet compared to this garbage. The wraps were shit, the tacos were shit, the pizza was shit, everything shit.  Have you ever played "Never Have I Ever..." Well, never have I ever wished I ate here.

Went here last night for my birthday dinner. Right when I got the table, they didn't clean the table it was very dirty I had to ask them to clean them. We got a Hawaiian pizza and fettucini alfredo pasta. It took about 30 mins to get our pizza. After 15 mins we got the pizza we didn't get the pasta. I told a waiter we haven't gotten our pasta, she said okay let me bring your waiter. We waited 10 mins then he came and say whats the problem told him that we didn't get our pasta. He say let me check , came back and say sorry we accidentally threw way the order receipt. The pasta came after 30 minutes after the pizza. Giving the restaurant 2 stars because the pizza was very good. Although the pasta had no flavor.

Haven't been to a CPK in ages.  I was expecting the tired novelty pizza menu instead we were pleasantly surprised to see many new items including thin pizza. We had the Quinoa salad and a pear pizza both were good. Service level was above average.

I like coming here. It's got a great location, being in the outdoor mall of State Street.  You can't ask for more. It is very open, like you could see all around the restaurant.  The pizza box artwork on the walls from a distance. My fiance got the Kung pao pasta, and I got a sandwich. We switch half way through our meal.  I wanted to take my food back from her.  I forgot out waitress' name, but I think if you look at her name tag, she'll be from Montana. That's a question to raise next time I go in one and test to see if they're really from the area. If I take my son out to the Zoo, this will be a stop before heading home. I will be a regular at this location, even though there is one in Ventura, just don't get the same atmosphere.

This was the first U.S. restaurant at which I dined after 18 hours and 6,503 miles of  airports, planes, cancelled and rebooked flights. I wanted some pasta or Creole food but couldn't really find a place still open to dine at after late afternoon meetings. I came across this CPK while scouting out my destination for tomorrow and saw they had Jambalaya Linguini as a new item. It features "blackened chicken and shrimp in spicy Jambalaya sauce with crawfish, Andouille sausage and Tasso ham on linguini fini, topped with scallion."  (from the CPK menu). Aha, methinks I can kill two birds with one stone but just kind of ended up with two dead birds in hand which were not worth any that might be in any kind of bush. These are all ingredients I like but one of the challenges of these different types of ingredients is that each cooks at different rates. Like cooking cioppino, you cook ingredients at different times so that each ends up cooked through without overcooking any of it.  The chicken was pretty rubbery. It had good ingredients that just didn't come together - it was spicy enough but somehow was lacking in flavor. I also had some artichoke and broccoli soup, which also had good ingredients but again, the whole was not better than the sum of the parts. I think I will stick to their pizzas and salads next time.
The most greatest California pizza kitchen this is my first time coming hear plz try Bianco flatbread .. It's yummy ...
Great for groups. Brian is the best server we've had in a long time. Period.

It shouldn't take this long to get a decent meal on a Monday night. They took long to take our order and far too long for plates to arrive at our table. When my daughter (12) asked for recommendation for a salad, she was encouraged to go for the Thai salad which is far too spicy for a kid. It's even too spicy for me. Poor service and glorified cafeteria food.

Every one knows about the great salads (i.e. Field Greens & the Original BBQ Chicken Chopped) and pasta (ie. Chicken Tequila or the Garlic Cream Fettuccines) as well as their signature pizzas (i.e. Pear & Gorgonzola & the Carne Asada). But, did you know they are revamping their dessert menu?  While here this last weekend, our awesome waitress not only filled us in, but let us try one of the new items ... the Butter Cake. The Butter Cake comes out super warm and moist with a very cold scoop of French vanilla ice cream melting on top, all surrounded by mounds of whipped cream. I don't normally get desserts, but man, this new cake was very delicious!  I cant' wait until the end of June, which is when the new dessert items are official!

With all of the great restaurants in this town my kids want to eat here....  The bloody Mary and margaritas were excellent. The kids ordered Pizza (bleh), I had the artichoke hearts (over cooked) and a wedge salad (kind of difficult to mess this up).

I try to come at off hours to avoid screaming children and/or long waits for a table.  The food is pretty standard, but some of the drinks are pretty strong (particularly the margaritas).  Sometimes the service can be a little slow even when it isn't crowded, but for the most part I think the servers are great.  Obviously it isn't the place for a fancy dinner downtown, but if you're looking for something casual or you work up an appetite while shopping, you probably won't go wrong here.

I go to this chain on occasion with other people, but I'm nor really a fan.  Pizza is OK, but there is better at most local places. They did have 50% off bottles of wine for New Years Eve though, so that one visit was great.

OK, I am f originally from  New York and have traveled the world so I am extremely fussy when it comes to fine dining. This is not fine dining but so delicious.  I am not a lover of chain restaurants however, this place far exceeds any chain restaurant I have ever eaten in. I was fortunate enough to have been invited there on  Saturday after the  Solstice Parade by a dear friend who came from  out of town to celebrate . It was her first time in  this Santa Barbara  California Pizza Kitchen She wanted to sample many different dishes She was so surprised  by the high quality and diversity of the menu. WE ordered  many dishes to share starting  with the Maine Lobster Flat Bread , consisting of arugula  garlic oil, dill,,lemon zest, red onion and mayonnaise served on a  large crispy wonton. This dish was amazing - the fusion of flavors melted on my tongue in unison. I felt  as if  I was in The Hampton's or Cape Cod  eating one of my favorite dishes,  lobster rolls, only this was even better. It came with four large pieces to share.  We then shared a thin crust Pizza of artichokes and spinach and it was out of this world-- cooked to perfection.  It was so nice to enjoy the cheese and vegetables and not feel like we were eating just dough  It was light and lovely. Next on the agenda was a pasta dish of  zucchini ribbons and  fettuccini  and shrimp  cooked in garlic, lemon, white wine, parsley and parmesan cheese..This dish was excellent as well. The  pasta  was prepared  just as we ordered it--al dente  And the shrimp were tender It was light and we were not weighed down with too much  pasta  The vegetable was the main attraction.The menu offered many wonderful choices of: salads and  appetizers and main dishes. it was so difficult  to finalize our  order. What helped us was the expert servers and manager Angel has been there for many years we were told  we were fortunate enough to have him  attend to our table, And Beau, was equally as great The Manager has been there for over ten years, what a testament of loyalty and great achievement  He also helped explain the different dishes to us in great detail. His name is Kevin Secky. He helped us decide which deserts to order as well.  We  look forward to retuning another time to sample some other alternatives. Perhaps for my Birthday in July ,as they offer a free Sunday to the person celebrating their Birthday .Talking about deserts we had our final  splurge, we each had an amazing one and shared them also. My friend ordered one  of  the most popular ones there - the manager told us - the butter cake- served with vanilla ice-cream on top of  and whipped cream formed like billowy  clouds all around the plate. I bit into it and it tasted like I was dancing on a carousel.  He told us some people come there just for this divine desert.  I ordered the red velvet cake sitting on top of vanilla cream  with white chocolate, shavings all along the back .The cake was so light and fluffy and the cream cheese iceing was incredibly delicious. The entire cake was so large we had to take half of it home.  We thoroughly enjoyed it the next day, as we did  all our leftovers. We looked around and others were enjoying their selections as well. Many were having wine that was paired  especially for  the dishes. I had iced tea and it was never  left  empty. My friend had a mango drink she enjoyed. The other manager who is also helpful is Michele Jones  She has been there the longest and treats the restaurant like it is her very own I was told.  And The manager from Ventura fills in sometimes- Molly --and she  was there and attentive to us .   And you are greeted from  the moment you walk in by the charming  Host  Jack who says hello and seats you where you will be most comfortable. On your way out  he says" goodbye ,have a nice day or evening ."  I know you will have a wonderful experience like my friend and I did at  The  California  Pizza Kitchen
I just don't like CPK. But the last time I went to CPK in SB, my soup was cold. How annoying.

Stopped here for a somewhat late dinner on our way down to LA.  We walked in 20 minutes before closing, but nobody had a look of "Dammit, I just want to get out of here, more customers?" look in their faces. We sat down and I was in the mood for a salad.  The few times I do actually go to CPK, always get the Thai Crunch Salad.  CPK salads are normally way overdressed, which is not what I was taught in culinary school, but for some reason, I really like the Thai Crunch Salad in its overdressed glory. What's good about it is that it's got a TON of stuff in it.  Sliced chicken, peanuts, edamame, crispy wonton strips, Jesus' tears, crispy rice noodles, green onions, the kitchen sink, a whole side of cow, cilantro, napa cabbage, a red velvet cupcake, the cute waitress' phone number (oops, did that slip out?), and just about everything else in their kitchen. It's just solid.... nothing really bad about it.  Just has a lot of different textures. Service is pretty standard for a casual chain restaurant.  Although coming here made me decide that I need to visit Santa Barbara a whole lot more.

My experience at this location was very disappointing. We just walked away.  I will not recommend this place if you like attention and professional courtesy from restaurant staff because that something you will receive here. this is what happened: We were seated after a long wait, restaurant was not busy. Staff were busy discussing their personal affairs in-front of the reception area.  At the table, no one prompt to take drinks order, which is customary anywhere i'd been.  After 15minutes, we ordered beer and a diet soda. The carbonated drink arrived in 10 minutes, but beer never arrived.   We concluded to walk away and leave enough money to cover the drink. Host immediately came and said "do you want to speak to a manager",  we just laugh.... and said "we just want to drink and eat". two things that never happened.  NOT GOING BACK THERE EVER.
Corporate restaurant.  What else is to expect. I'd try some of the other restaurants around town first.  However, if you are craving good American food...this is not a bad spot.

I tried something new on their menu during our visit, but I didn't think I would order everything that was new to the menu.  The citrus cooler (non-alcoholic) was thirst quenching and good, but I guess to be great I should have had it with some liquor. The new Morrocan chicken salad is now my all-time favorite salad here. The dates with beets and roasted butternut squash with the champagne dressing is super delicious. There wasn't much chicken, I almost missed the few pieces that were buried underneath the salad. And my favorite dessert of all time has made it to CPK, strawberry shortcake! I had to compare this to Cheesecake Factory's version and I have to say that CPK has the upper hand, warmed and soft scone with rock sugar has set this apart from CF's. I do recommend that CPK add more strawberries, you don't even get half a pint basket-it is called a strawberry shortcake. Service was good, and the staff friendly and helpful. Love this place.

We went their for lunch arriving at 11:45.  We were promptly seated.  The waitress came around about 10 minutes later to take our drink order.  We ordered our meal with the drinks and it arrived 15 minutes later.  Not bad considering the pizza takes 10 minutes to cook. I had the Sicillian pizza, wife had the mushroom pizza.  One daughter had the 5 cheese pizza and the other had avocado egg rolls. My pizza was good.  Crispy thin crust with flavorful toppings.  The crust got soggy in the middle half way through my eating it from the grease in the sausage, but it was still strong enough to eat.  My wife devoured the mushroom pizza. We were in, ate at a leisurely pace and were out within the free parking time.  The kitchen looked clean from where we were sitting and the service was decent.  The place was pretty full when we left at half past twelve. 10-12 dollar entrees make this a place we won't be going every day but the do make decent food.

CPK is always a favorite of the family. Why? The choices are safe for the family that has different taste buds. While we were in Santa Barbara, we went to this particular one. Maybe it was the day (Sunday), and it definitely wasn't the time (3:00pm), but the service was just ok. It was seemed small inside, at least smaller than a few other CPK restaurants that I have been to, and the service was a little slow.  Besides, you're in Santa Barbara, there are probably so much other places that are worth going to. ;)
I love the pasta dishes at this location. I have always had great service, especially from chase! Keep up the great work CPK!
Always good which ever CPK you go to! Great Pizza, Salads and Drinks. My favorites are the Tortilla Soup, Chocolate Soufflé Cake, and Korean BBQ Steak Tacos!

Is CPK trying to be fancy destination dining, or mainstream chain food. Their locations in shopping malls, their mass marketing, their uniform service all indicate mainstream chain food. But their prices say fancy dining. Something is not right. Single pizzas and salads are in the range of $12 each. When the restaurant is set next door to a Panda Express and Ruby's Diner at Paseo Nuevo - both cheap chain food eats - I wonder how CPK can compete. Yet, it's always busy.  I avoided CPK for years, and it wasn't until it was the meal provided at a working lunch that I first tried it.  It's good, it's fine, it's definitely more creative with its topping combinations than other pizza chains.  If I had to choose between CPK and, uh, avoiding the Noid, I'll take CPK.  I ate there the other day and shared the small pizza with one other. We ordered the mango chicken curry pizza and yes, it was good. But...couldn't we have gone to the local Indian restaurant, ordered a curry and spooned it onto our naan? It's the same thing. I'll probably eat here again, but only after I've exhausted all other options, or if the company is paying.

Good pizza. It does take awhile to get your pizza, but I don't mind it so much, because the pizzas are just so darn amazing. I tried the Mango Tandoori Chicken, the Thai Chicken, and the Buffalo Chicken. All of them are soo mouthwateringly good. And the painted CPK boxes hanging on the walls make such cute decor.
It's like all the other CPKs I've ever been to. I love their Caesar chicken salad. It's the best to me. The service is decent but if you have little ones they will sit you in the back.

Food is yummy but pricy. Especially considering that fact that I can whip up just as good of a pasta at home for a fraction of the price. Hence, to justify eating here and paying a pinky for the meal, get the Jambalaya ~ ! Nom nom. It's been a stable of mine for the past.. lifetime. It's spicy, flavorful and loaded with all the goodness you'll ever want to find on a plate. Service is always friendly as well. =)

This restaurant is the quintessential nod to California Cuisine--serving everything from a wide variety of salads and pizzas to burgers, hot and cold sandwiches and pasta dishes. If you think your favorite ingredients belong on pizza, they probably can get there at California Pizza Kitchen. Some local favorite toppings include barbecued chicken and goat cheese. And by all means,don't forget to save room for dessert so you can sample their New York Style Cheese cake or sit pretty in front of a standard but scrumptious hot fudge sundae.  No matter what your palette is craving in the pizza department, you can find it here.  Some words of warning, though...substitutions on pre-made pizzas and some pre-prepared dishes as I remember from a few orders are a little more than their kitchen staff can handle, so if you order a menu item rather than create your own be fully prepared to like it as large scale changes may not be possible.  And certainly be sure not to stuff yourself as full as any stuffed crust pizza that they might order, as you might consider taking in the carefully crafted, colorful decor that is such a dazzling surprise for their diners rather than a made dash to the dark caverns of their albeit clean and large public restroom.
Pizza is good, service isn't great and don't let them fool you saying that you have to wait 20 minutes: in 2 minutes I was sitting there, ready to order. The waitress, Traci, was pretty slow.

CPK is my kid's favorite resto. It's sort of automatic for me as far as what to order. I always get the same thing pasta with garlic cream sauce with chicken and mushrooms. The difference is in the service. The particular day that we came by we were seated immediately, orders taken right away, our drinks refilled promptly... Good visit for us this time :)
I highly recommend the garlic cream fettuccine with chicken. Delicious and the portion was just right. Friendly service, expect to wait 10-15 minutes to get seated on a relatively busy day.

This place is honestly so great. The customer service, the manager talks to everyone and is so cool and sweet. Their entire staff is AWESOME. The food, is delicious. The buffalo sauce cauliflower and avocado rolls are our favorite. The cucumber revival and fresh brewed iced tea are delicious. We come here all the time because it's simply great. They do a great job here and should be applauded for it!!  Also,  Our server Greg was great :)

Not a huge fan of chain restaurant food, you can really tell that it is mass produced. Service was fine, food ready quickly, but I feel the prices really don't justify the quality of the food. My salad was huge, but really anything other than healthy. The pizzas are on the small side and the noodle dishes lacking flavor. While this is a more affordable dining option that some others here, I would splurge and eat something better while in Santa Barbara, not worth returning.

I love the food here. I usually come to this location twice a month (and because I live blocks away from here). Everytime I used to come here, it was ok. Again food is great, but service is awful. Although, I never feel the need to complaint. Sometime 2 weeks ago, we came again, we got sat right away. But bummmm, I saw a server passing by many times and she just ignored us, I called her many times, but she just ignored us.. Such a pain everytime she was taking care of the rest of the customers and keep ignoring us. Finally someone else pass by and I called her, we waited around 30 mins to been noticed. She said sorry, I will call your server. But when she tried to call her it seems that she didnt want to take our order. Anyways at the end someone else took our order and the other girl who supposed to be our server never even say sorry or anything. She was giving us a really bad attitude, like if she didnt even wanted us there. HER NAME IS LIZ, it was the only thing I needed to know after I left the restaurant. It was very frustrating been there, and the only reason why I stay was because my daughters were starving. I would never go there anymore... Now I dislike this location. (I even called corporate) Update So I got a private message by someone who runs the yelp page (from CPK office) and trying to apologize, they ask me to filled out some info online and they were gonna get back to me. But they never did. That's how you lose customers, and end up going out of business.
CPK is our " Go To " place. We eat in and order out and always fresh and great! One of the Managers " Michelle" is always so sweet to us !!

I very much thought of this place to be very good and I loved how we were seated at our table by a friendly younger boy who actually did his job very well! I loved the attitude! We were even recommended these specialty drinks they had only at the pizza kitchen I was iffy about but was NOT disappointed. The food came out great and even the simple chips & salsa didn't seem stale because have come across a majority of places that have the worst when it comes to that. The vibe was pretty friendly and our server was nice. No second guessing while we were there at all. It wasn't so busy either because it was on a Saturday. I would to like try the rest of the plates and entrees they had to offer so next time! The area seems a bit clean but not a lot of resources stocked fully when I was using the restroom. If I'm ever in the area again craving the same thing from last time I'll be back again.

I typically don't like writing reviews that are below 4 stars, but tonight, I wasn't all too impressed with CPK.  We were seated right away, which wasn't all too surprising, considering my significant other and I came at around 8pm on a Wednesday night. We started off with the avocado egg rolls, which comprise of chicken, bacon, cheese, and avocado. Now normally these egg rolls are amazing, but it wasn't hot when we got them. It tasted it they were out for a while. Next came the waldorf chicken salad and the california club pizza. The waldorf salad was simple, but flavorful. I think there was slightly too much dressing, but that's okay. I really love the gorgonzola in the salad- paired nicely with the apples and candied walnuts! The california club pizza on the other hand... while the avocados and tomatoes were fresh, the pizza itself wasn't hot. Again, it seemed like the pizza was sitting out. The pizza itself was stale, which is really disappointing, considering I was craving this pizza tonight.  The server was okay, but she didn't ask us if we wanted dessert, which made me think that maybe she just wanted to close out and go home? I don't know- I really wanted the butter cake, but I lost my appetite once I felt like we were being somewhat rushed. Not sure how I feel about CPK after this experience. It's not a 1 star, but I was definitely disappointed.
Special menu for us veterans on Veterans Day. I chose the BBQ Chicken salad. It came with warm bread and an olive oil herb dip. Thanks for your cheerful and generous service!

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary dinner and I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty the food was! My boyfriend got the Louisiana style jambalaya and I got a barbecue chicken pizza. Both plates were pretty good (even though this restaurant is a little pricey). Overall, I really enjoyed my dinner here and I had a great time!

My boyfriend and I came here on a semi crowded night and were seated after 15 minutes or so.  We got seated in a very dark table and I asked if they could turn on our light but I guess they hadn't replaced it yet. It was so dark to the point I need to use my phone to read the menu.  Anyways, our waitress gave us our bread and asked us multiply times if we wanted more bread so it seemed she was overwhelmed. We ordered our drinks and it took longer than usual for her to give us the drink but I guess they were having problems with their ticket machine.   I signed up for the rewards and received a free small plate. We chose the white corn and guacamole and chips for our free plate. It was good but the guacamole and corn is very small and it needed salt.   I ordered a Hawaiian pizza and my boyfriend ordered the original bbq chicken which were all very tasty :)  Although they were many problems, I would still come back.

Place is a lot bigger inside than I realized.  My brother and I stopped in here ... to be honest, I have two distinct memories of CPK.  1) The Twilight premier when I was taken here by the girl I was going with, and 2) a really awkward lunch with two people who weren't really my friends. Thankfully this experience was a lot better than the last two, because I had always thought CPK was a good "fast food" option, and it was affirmed going here last night. My bro and I were seated at a 2 person booth.  We were offered fresh bread.  Our waitress was really nice (don't remember her name) and attentive.  I really loved my strawberry lemonade I got, and my bro tried it and liked it too! My bro ordered a four cheese and tomato pizza and seemed to enjoy it.  I got one of their seasonal specials, a curly pasta in a mushroom sauce.  Yummmm, it was so good!  My bro kept on stealing it from me so I had to give him some. I was really pleased with the amount of vegetarian options that CPK offers.  It makes me really happy to see restaraunts who are willing to serve all kinds of customers -- especially having one of their monthly specials be vegetarian (and marking what's vegetarian with a symbol on the menu)  I know that, in the future, I will come back to CPK if it's an option in the mall.

the prices have gone way up I went in a month ago and it was a three ring child circus. For dining somewhere where you are going to spend 50 dollars on a chain for one person it should not be chucky cheese. The staff didn't seem to care and seated families close to me when there were other spots available. Then they send pizza kitchen emails. No, No thank you for this price I can eat at the wine cask a real honest to God Santa Barbara nice dining place and not have to deal with kids r us

Our server last night was horrible! I didn't get her name but she was a (white?) female with short dark red hair... She never came to check on us, I had to keep calling her over when I wanted something. She never refilled my drink even though the empty glass was at the edge of the table. Even if she was serving the table next to us, she never stopped at our table to see if we needed anything.  Because she never checked on us, we were there for a long time as there would be long periods of time where I wouldn't see her. At one point I even asked another server, Virginia, to refill my drink. Virginia was so friendly and when she brought my drink she asked if there was anything else we needed! That's all we expect from a good server- attentiveness. Thank you Virginia!

After a good while of trying to avoid chains I ended up at CPK, and you know what, they could be an exception to the idea that chains are bland.  It was good, real good. SO is very concerned with hygiene practices and rightly or wrongly sees corporately owned businesses as having to be held to the standards of a high visibility, as a result it can make choosing a place to eat out difficult.  So...we ended up at CPK in Santa Barbara.  Really though, I liked it, she felt comfortable and in the end that's what matters most. Jerk Chicken thin crust...good.  Sweet in the right way, tangy in the right way.  All around a good little pie.  Beer selection it's alright...could definitely use a couple more taps, and probably less Sam Adams. Service good, better than most mid level chains, ambiance definitely better than most.  Clean decor, nice airy main dining room.   Hopefully the hygiene practices fear is a passing one, but I would go back to CPK either way.

Has very good safety protocols for preparing gluten free pizzas. Being a celiac, this is extremely comforting when eating out. The pizza was fairly good. My only critique was that it was a bit pricey for the size it was.

After waiting for 20 mins the couple next to us left the restaurant. We stayed there some more mins and left as well. This is ridiculous!!!  No service at all. It's not recommendable.  I would give no stars if possible.

We love it here! The manager, Michelle, is always SO SWEET when we come, taking the time to make sure our experience is a positive one. For Mother's Day, she was giving out little gift bags. How sweet is that?!! The food here never disappoints, and our server Krystal checked on us often, making sure all dishes were great. Thank you for making today special!!!
Good Pizza place and I love their Pizza It's so good there. They have excellent service and great staff. I went here like 4 times with a group and 2 times with a friend Definitely coming here again.

Just like any other CPK in any other city. If you're just visiting SB I wouldn't come here because there's just so many other places you can try that are local and mom and pop places! You can try CPK anywhere else.. but I have been here a few times. Pizza is great as it should be.

Saturday night n it was busy. Still, we got a seat within 15 min. My usual order at any CPK is one of their specialty salads n jambalaya. So I got the half order of grilled veggie salad and the jambalaya (only one size available for jambalaya).... N I gotta have the olive oil on the table, I drown everything in it)... Jambalaya was delicious as always, spicy with black pepper and chunky with fat shrimps, crawfish, chicken, sausages... My BF ordered the chicken tequila fettuccine which was WOW, my new fave! Such great flavors. Our server was very good with checking on us. He was constantly apologizing cuz food was very slow to come outta the kitchen. Maybe cuz everyone was ordering pasta. The manager was also making her rounds apologizing n comping desserts and bringing out more bread. Our usual 1.5 hour dining became a 2.5 hour waitfest. Took the butter cake to go and that was pretty good.  Still, love our waiter. Loved the food. Loved my company.... All was still brilliant.
Service was good, every dish and glass was disgustingly dirty!!!  Where are the health inspectors?
